documentation.text:
@title ArbitrableProxy
  A general purpose arbitrable contract. Supports non-binary rulings.

@dev Constructor
  @param _arbitrator Target global arbitrator for any disputes.

changeMultipliers(uint256,uint256,uint25.details: Changes the proportion of appeal fees that must be paid by winner and loser and changes the appeal period portion for losers.

params._loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: The new loser appeal period multiplier respect to DENOMINATOR. Having a value greater than DENOMINATOR has no effect since arbitrator limits appeal period.
params._loserStakeMultiplier: The new loser stake multiplier value respect to DENOMINATOR.
params._winnerStakeMultiplier: The new winner stake multiplier value respect to DENOMINATOR.

params._arbitrator: Target global arbitrator for any disputes.

createDispute(bytes,string,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Calls createDispute function of the specified arbitrator to create a dispute. Note that we dont need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as its the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._arbitratorExtraData: Extra data for the arbitrator of prospective dispute.
params._metaevidenceURI: Link to metaevidence of prospective dispute.

returns.disputeID: Dispute id (on arbitrator side) of the dispute created.

fundAppeal(uint256,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Manages contributions and calls appeal function of the specified arbitrator to appeal a dispute. This function lets appeals be crowdfunded.

params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._ruling: The ruling to which the caller wants to contribute.

returns.fullyFunded: Whether _ruling was fully funded after the call.

returns._loserAppealPeriodMultiplier: Multiplier for losers appeal period. The loser is given less time to fund its appeal to defend against last minute appeal funding attacks.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.details: This function has O(m) time complexity where m is number of rounds.  It is safe to assume m is always less than 10 as appeal cost growth order is O(2^m).

params._contributor: The contributor for which to query.
params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._ruling: The ruling option to search for potential withdrawal. Caller can obtain this information using Contribution events.

returns.sum: The total amount available to withdraw.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: To be called by the arbitrator of the dispute, to declare winning ruling.

params._externalDisputeID: ID of the dispute in arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: The ruling choice of the arbitration.

params._newGovernor: The address of the new governor.

submitEvidence(uint256,string).details: Allows to submit evidence for a given dispute.

params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,u.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets solved.

params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.
params._ruling: The ruling option that the caller wants to withdraw fees and rewards related to it.

returns.amount: Reward amount that is to be withdrawn. Might be zero if arguments are not qualifying for a reward or reimbursement, or it might be withdrawn already.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint2.details: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For all rounds at once.  This function has O(m) time complexity where m is number of rounds.  It is safe to assume m is always less than 10 as appeal cost growth order is O(2^m).  Thus, we can assume this loop will run less than 10 times, and on average just a few times.

params._contributor: The address to withdraw its rewards.
params._localDisputeID: Index of the dispute in disputes array.
params._ruling: Rulings that received contributions from contributor.

externalIDtoLocalID.details: Maps external (arbitrator side) dispute id to local (arbitrable) dispute id.

params._externalDisputeID: Dispute id as in arbitrator contract.

externalIDtoLocalID.return: localDisputeID Dispute id as in arbitrable contract.

numberOfRulingOptions.details: Returns number of possible ruling options. Valid rulings are [0, return value].

params._localDisputeID: Identifier of a dispute in scope of arbitrable contract. Arbitrator ids can be translated to local ids via externalIDtoLocalID.

numberOfRulingOptions.return: count The number of ruling options.

devdoc.title: ArbitrableProxy  A general purpose arbitrable contract. Supports non-binary rulings.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.notice: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount.
